title: Progressive Reactivity with NgRx/Component-Store, Akita, Elf, RxAngular and RxJS
description: In this series I came up with 3 rules to achieve progressive reactivity. Following them reduced the code for NgRx/Component-Store by 12%, Akita by 9%, Elf by 13%, RxAngular by 7%, and RxJS ('Subjects in a Service') by 22%. Here they are again:

title: 6 Effective Ways to Unsubscribe in RxJS
description: Let's talk about the top 6 ways to handle unsubscribing in RxJS, followed by a discussion on what happens when you don't manage them properly!

title: How to apply Material theme colors for your Angular Component
description: TLDR; Create a @mixin to receive the $theme as a parameter, so that you can get the colors you need from the $theme and apply it to your css selectors. Then include the mixin into your styles.scss.

title: What is SSR and SSG in Angular?
description:
Why I am writing this article?

Recently I worked on the website for Ashutec which is built using Angular 13. It's a public face website site so there was a requirement to make it SEO-friendly and improve Initial page load time.(photo: by frank mckenna on Unsplash)

title: What's New in Angular 14? Here Are the Highlights
description: Angular version 14 has arrived. This is a new major version of the popular front-end framework, and it comes with some exciting new features and improvements.

title: Angular Lazy Loading Explained
Build your first MEAN Application - Part 1 of 4: Angular Single Page Application
description: In this 4-part series we will look at how to create a MEAN application. A MEAN application uses Mongo DB, Express JS, Angular and Node JS to create a full-stack application. This first part of the series will create the foundations of our Angular single page application. We will create an application to store a personal diary that displays our posts in a table. We will be able to add, delete and update posts within the application and to store the data in an array.

title: Workflow of Angular
description: This blog explains the flow that happens to display the angular application in the browser which cannot be seen but can be aware of, in order to get a better understanding of the Angular application and to improve debugging.

title: Angular reactive forms - Part 1
description: In this video we are going to learn how to create basic reactive form in Angular. Also we are going to learn about Form Control and Form Group.

title: Angular app i18n: ngx-translate with custom TranslateParser-Hyphenation
description: I have already implemented ngx-translate library into my project by following steps from this ngx-translate/core README.md file. https://github.com/ngx-translate/core

title: How to access Angular component from Testcafe E2E test
description: When it comes to E2E testing, it is crucial to start all tests from the same clean state and configuration and without any leftovers from the previous run, unless your test intend to test that and even then, you probably would like to control what specific configuration use in each test.

title: Angular Service Integration (Adding service into an angular app) (Learn it in 10 Steps)
description: This project will explain to you, How to integrate the pokeman API inside the Angular app and service integration

title: Getter and Setter in Angular | Angular Tutorial
Angular For Beginners - 29. ngContainer vs. ngTemplate vs. ngContent
Angular Pipes - Brief Explanation
description: Brief and concise explanation of what pipes are in angular and how we utilize them to make our development easier.

title: map/concatMap/mergeMap/switchMap/exhaustMap - Rxjs Transformation operators in Angular 14 tutorial
description: We explore the different tranformation operators which are available with the latest version of Rxjs using an angular 14 applications. The below operators are explored: map, concatMap, mergeMap, switchMap, exhaustMap, buffer, bufferCount, bufferTime, bufferToggle, window, windowCount, windowTime, windowToggle, windowWhen, expand, groupBy, pairwise, scan, mergeScan and switchScan

title: Adding Type Safety to Angular Material Dialog
description: Let's make mat-dialog check for the correct data types.

title: Angular Material Table With Search by Query Params Using Node JS API (Learn it in 28 Steps includes Filter and Search- MrYenagandula)
description: Please find the below steps to show the Angular Material table with filters and NodeJS API and apply search and filter in Angular application.

title: Clean up your Components using Directives!
description: I've been using Angular for a while (since version 2), but I had never put enough effort into understanding how to make out the most of directives; I occasionally used them, but not as frequently as I should have been.

title: Decentralized... Backend? Building An Angular dApp With OrbitDB And IPFS
description: I built a decentralized, p2p message client with no backend server that runs entirely in the browser.

title: Clean Architecture in Frontend
description: I wanted to share several insights that I found helpful for large-scale front-end applications. I want to talk about ideas that proved reliable in practice. At the same time, I pursue simplicity in my explanations.

title: Tweeks of ngOnChanges using objects | Parent to child communication | Angular 14 | Part 3
description:
In this video we will learn What are the different tweeks and problems we face when we are using an object as data passage.
1. What are the problems we face when we send an object from parent to child.
2. When we update an object how does ngOnChanges behaves.
3. Life Cycle hooks
4. How to resolve the problems when we are using ngOnChanges.

title: Different relationships among Angular Components | Angular Tutorial
Angular Sudoku 3 - Storybook and CSS Debugging
description: We show how to pin versions using volta. We use Storybook to work on the CellComponent and the GridComponent. We use CSS variables to size the grid appropriately. We use a couple of different methods to debug CSS issues.

title: How to publish an Angular app to Firebase Hosting using Github Actions
description: The purpose of this post is to publish an Angular application within a Firebase project using the Firebase Hosting product. To automate the deploy we will use a Github Actions pipeline that will be triggered in every commit on the main branch.

title: Multilingual Angular App hosted on Firebase and Surge with the same build
description: Last time we figured out a way to prefix all routes without changing the base href, using APP_BASE_HREF token in Angular, which helped us host on Netlify a same-build multilingual App. Today we shall try Firebase and Surge.sh.

title: Auth Guard | Angular Security | How to protect component or module from an unauthorize user
description: This is part 12 of Angular 14 series and in this session I have explained about the auth guard, How to protect component or module from an unauthorize user.

title: Render content based on viewport size with a directive
description: In this post I am going to describe how to use angular https://material.angular.io/cdk/layout/overview to build a structural directive that controls the rendering of components.

title: Add Source Maps locally
description: The next explanations are based on this project. To get the most of this article it is recommended to not only read it, but to practice creating a similar project.

title: Tweeks of ngOnChanges using array | Parent to child communication | Angular 14 | Part 4
description:
In this video we will learn What are the different tweeks and problems we face when we are using an array as data passage.
1. What are the problems we face when we send an array from parent to child.
2. When we update an array how does ngOnChanges behaves.
3. Life Cycle hooks
4. How to resolve the problems when we are using ngOnChanges with array.

title: S2E30 | Mike Pearson on Just Trying Things and StateAdapt
description: For his work on State Adapt we have Michael Pearson on the show today. We want to learn more about innovating & creating, but especially why and how you can “just try things” even when imposter syndrome gets the better of you.

title: Building Angular Electron Application
description: Electron is a free and open-source framework that is developed and maintained by GitHub. You can utilize this framework to design desktop applications using the web technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS as well as other frontend frameworks and Web Assembly.

title: Get to Know the 2022 ng-conf Speakers | Alain Chautard | ng-conf 2022
@Input in Angular | Sharing data from parent to child component | Angular Tutorial
Traveling to ng-conf and visiting US for the first time
description: The ng-conf has a long history and has always been my dream to visit. I was always watching the live event each year but participating in person is an absolutely different experience. Finally in early 2020 I've decided to purchase an early bird ticket and was so excited about it, but everyone is aware of what's happening next - the COVID-2019 pandemic and so all in-person events had to be postponed.

title: Cypress Component Testing in Angular
description: This video introduces you to Cypress Component testing in Angular and also argues that it will be the way how to test components in the near future.

title: A reusable cascade animation with Angular Animation
description:
Hi guys, how is everything??

Have you ever thought about how to make the user experience better when we have a list of cards!?

Today, I gonna show how we can do it with a card 'cascade' animation and have a nice card page using the power of Angular Animations!
